Authors:
Sai Gong, Xiu-Ting Zhang, Shu-Xia Jiang, Chen Chen,
Hong-Bing Ma, Yang Nie
Title:
A new species of Ophiognomonia from Northern China identified
inhabiting the lesion spots of chestnut leaves infected with Phomopsis
castaneae-mollissimae
Keywords:
Ophiognomonia castanea, Phomopsis castaneae-mollissimae,
multi-gene analysis, teleomorph, anamorph
Abstract:
An undescribed fungus inhabiting the lesion spotsof
chestnut leaves infected withPhomopsis castaneae-mollissimae was
identified as a new species- Ophiognomonia castanea(Ophiognomonia,
Gnomoniaceae, Diaporthales).In this study, morphological
characterization and multi-gene analysis ofthethree markers [internal
transcribed spacer (ITS) regions 1 and 2, which included the 5.8S
ribosomal RNA gene, guanine nucleotide-binding protein subunit beta gene
(MS204) andtranslation elongation factor 1-ï¡ gene(tef1-ï¡) were used to
identify apreviouslyundescribed fungus.The teleomorphic and anamorphic
stages are described and illustrated.
